agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Public Health SUBCOMMITTEE: Health Professions TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 4, 2019 PLACE: E2.012 CHAIR: Rep. J. D. Sheffield *The chair may limit testimony time and the number of testifying witnesses as necessary to ensure consideration of posted and pending business, especially if testimony would cause the public hearing to extend into the next calendar day. HB 29 Minjarez | et al. Relating to the regulation of the practice of physical therapy. HB 912 Howard Relating to an expedited licensing process for certain advanced practice registered nurses; authorizing a fee. HB 1092 Zedler Relating to the prescriptive authority of certain psychologists; authorizing a fee. HB 1748 Oliverson Relating to continuing education requirements for surgical technologists. HB 1792 Klick | et al. Relating to the authority of certain advanced practice registered nurses. HB 2275 Klick Relating to the regulation of the practice of dental hygiene. HB 2733 Stephenson | et al. Relating to the scope of practice for chiropractors. HB 3194 Wu Relating to the regulation of the practice of acupuncture. HB 3458 Dutton | et al. Relating to the administration of an immunization or vaccination by a pharmacist. HB 3878 Stucky | et al. Relating to the requirement to obtain a license to practice as an anesthesiologist assistant; providing an administrative penalty; authorizing fees. HB 4325 Sheffield Relating to the establishment and maintenance of a glaucoma comanagement registry. HB 4412 Sheffield Relating to the licensing and regulation of surgical assistants. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. Bills added after last posting: HB 2733 ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
